content.description:
Head up the arete right of Dr. Stoppage. A few sidepulls to a step out right. Slopey holds and an awkward crux with a blocky undercling. Cool arete moves to the top of the pillar.Â 



Obvious bolted arete right side of crag.

13 quickdraws, 60m rope

climbs.name: Approach Shoe Express
climbs.fa: Daunte, Rezaie, Randy Kiel- basiewicz, Rafael Kolodziejczyk, May 2022

content.description:
Pitch 1, Climb slab to anchors on right.

Pitch 2, Move right, climb layback corner to a ledge. Follow steep arete until you can move left onto the face.

Pitch 3, 3rd class scramble to bolted anchors



2nd route from the left on Ramparts cliff

bolts. walk off.

climbs.name: Doctor Stoppage
climbs.fa: Reg Smart, David Smart, Brandon Pullan 2021

content.description:
Up the wide crack with a small roof. Big holds and fun climbing! Fully bolted.



Look for the only wide crack left of a pinnacle.

10 quickdraws, 60m rope

climbs.name: Marshmallow Man
climbs.fa: Dave Smart, Reg Smart, Brandon Pullan, Sept. 2021

content.description:
Pitch 1, Up slight broken groove to belay next to a pine tree.

Pitch 2, up, step right to small arete, climb that. Continue to anchors at top.



30 m left of Doctor Stoppage (Big black crack on right end of cliff)

Anchors at top of cliff. No rings. (Walk off)

Can be seen in the distance to the NNW beyond Fortress

BE AWARE: LOOSE AND SHARP ROCK IS COMMON AT THIS CLIFF!!! CLIMB WITH CAUTION AND MANAGE ROPES WITH ATTENTION WHEN DESCENDING. NEW ROUTE DEVELOPMENT IS ONGOING AND MAY CURRENTLY BE UDERWAY IN ANY OF THESE AREAS. RED TAGS ARE SOMETIMES BUT NOT ALWAYS PRESENT.


Can be seen in the distance to the NNW beyond Fortress

BE AWARE: LOOSE AND SHARP ROCK IS COMMON AT THIS CLIFF!!! CLIMB WITH CAUTION AND MANAGE ROPES WITH ATTENTION WHEN DESCENDING. NEW ROUTE DEVELOPMENT IS ONGOING AND MAY CURRENTLY BE UDERWAY IN ANY OF THESE AREAS. RED TAGS ARE SOMETIMES BUT NOT ALWAYS PRESENT.
